snippet: On Jan. 4, 1965, in his State of the Union address, President Lyndon B. Johnson outlined the goals of ”the Great Society,” a set of domestic programs designed to advance civil rights and aid those in poverty.
abstract: On Jan. 4, 1965, in his State of the Union address, President Lyndon B. Johnson outlined the goals of ”the Great Society,” a set of domestic programs designed to advance civil rights and aid those in poverty.

headline.main: Jan. 4, 1965 | Lyndon Johnson Outlines 'Great Society' Plans
